titleStmt.title: Letter Requesting Expedited Delivery of Nails for Shipbuilding
titleStmt.author: Kurrah ben Sharik

msContents.summary: Letter (entagion) presumably from the governor of Egypt, Kurrah b. Sharik, to the pagarch, Basilius, asking for expedited delivery of nails to be used to build ships

msItemStruct.note: 4 lines, written against the fibers and constituting the right half of lines 7-10 of P.Lond. IV 1390; the back is blank
German translation of lines 7-10 on p. 37 of ed.pr.
For the date, see BL VI, 122, which is based on the fragments reported on p. 38 of ed.pr.; see apis.26

provenance.p: From the collection of N. Likhachov; once housed in the Paleographical Museum of the Academy of Science in St. Petersburg; now in the Hermitage Museum

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.

div.ab: Lines 7-10: As soon as you receive the present letter, immediately and without a moment's delay send the nails that have been ordered through your office, as has been said. If you can find it in you, do not hinder this in any way.

listBibl.bibl: P.Ross.Georg. IV 9 P.Lond. IV 1390.1-10 (left half of the lines) BL VI, 122; BL XI, 188; for discussion of the letters of Kurrah b. Sharik see H. Cadell, "Correspondance de Kurrah ben Sharik" Recherches de Papyrologie IV (1967), 107-160, esp. 133-160
